If you want any help with this I'd be happy to pitch in.  I've been trying =
to get my own java NEAT implementation going recently, focused on distribut=
ed execution.  I'm a java developer. 

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Trevor =
Burton <worldofpaper@...> wrote:
>
> I recently asked about C# and Java ver=
sions of NEAT.
> 
> I downloaded Ugo Vierucci's JNEAT code, got it working =
and started having a
> nose through the source - it's a bit of a mess and d=
ifficult to follow or
> adapt because of that. So i thought i'd take a crac=
k at refactoring it a
> little and that little has ended up being a complet=
e re-write. I've given it
> the rather imaginative title of JNEAT2 - but th=
is'll probably change when
> the right name suggests itself.
> 
> I'm not f=
inished yet but thought i'd just post as i've been really enjoying
> this p=
roject and hopefully others will find it useful once i'm done.
> 
> Basical=
ly i've:
> 
> 
>    - Seperated the core NEAT classes from the UI and the l=
oading mechanism -
>    There's a nice easy way of creating new UI's to vie=
w the evolution/winners
>    etc. etc. now.
>    - All the properties are l=
oaded via Spring's IOC container - so
>    everything is in easy-to-read xm=
l or properties files.
>    - Experiments are created as JAR files - with a=
ll the spring context
>    files defining the experiment's parameters/genom=
es/training data etc and
>    compiled .class files inside - these are load=
ed by JNEAT2 and the experiment
>    can be executed - the settings can be =
adjusted and the experiment re-run or
>    saved back out as a new JAR file=
 so experiments can easily be transferred.
> 
> 
> I'm a Flash/Flex develop=
er primarily so my interest in abstracting the UI
> elements is so i can bu=
ild a Flex client for this Java 'back-end' - this way
> i can have a web-ba=
sed interface for experiments.
> 
> This is purely a personal project at th=
e moment - so i plan on releasing the
> finished code as an open-source pro=
ject and developing some experiments with
> it once i've got things working=
.
> 
> I'll keep the list updated with my progress and if anyone has any
> =
comments/suggestions/requests feel free to drop me a line.
> 
> Regards
> 
=
> -- 
> Trevor Burton
> http://www.flashmonkey.org
> http://www.infrared5.c=
om
>
